inlineContent.text: The user will be able to bind device first time on the onboarding flow, once he enteres his phone number, the
it will send all data required and user will receive sms to verify his number. once this is done. the primary device considered binded.

If user logged in using another device. a push notification will be sent to his other devices that is bounded. now he need to go there and approve the transaction. if the user lost his device some how but he still have access to the sim card that he registed with, he can bypass the transaction approval by send sms. If he successfully entered that he will be bounded as well.

abstract.text: A user can have more than device binded to his account. but he need a primary one first. here is the steps for how to do that.

Before you start integrating , you need to figure out if the proccess you want to have a TAN process on  is a process you want the user to wait for approval from another device or it will happen seemlessly on the same device.
TAN is a package that includes Device binding mechanisms and Reacting to Transactions
